pr_title: NMS-7547: fix UTF-8 comparison decoding hex strings

timeline.message:
Fixed bug NMS-7547 by updating UTF-8 detection function for SNMP values. Added
unit test for this function.
NMS-7547: fix processing of bad/weird LLDP IDs
NMS-7547: fix processing of bad/weird LLDP IDs
NMS-7547: revert changes from NMS-8915 now that this is fixed

timeline.bodyText:
So basically we are limiting the displayable to UTF-8 validation.
If Enlinkd expects this way, that's fine.
Otherwise I'm good with skipping the test validation for values in order to get the original fix of preventing ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
timeline.author: cgorantla

replies.bodyText: I could still make it fall back to trying ASCII at least.  Though in this case that's still a single ï character, which also seems wrong -- I suspect these devices have a bug in their "null entry" responses that cause this.
replies.author: RangerRick

replies.bodyText: It used to return cf though, so treating it as UTF-8 text seems to keep the same behavior here.
replies.author: RangerRick

replies.bodyText: I'm open to either way of doing it, if you have a preference.
replies.author: RangerRick
